intro: Graffenrieda barahonensis, commonly known as the Barahonensis graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy and oval in shape. Graffenrieda barahonensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
